comments:
I am using Eclipse 3.2 and WST 1.5 is installed. I am trying to create Bottom up Web Service. I am getting following error. HelloWorldImpl class is same project directory under folder src. I am not sure what is missing. Any help and suggestion is appreciated

=====IWAB0398E Error in generating WSDL from Java:  java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.tibco.webservice.test.HelloWorldImpl
    java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.tibco.webservice.test.HelloWorldImpl
    at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleLoader.findClass(BundleLoader.java:407)
    at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleLoader.findClass(BundleLoader.java:352)
    at org.eclipse.osgi.internal.baseadaptor.DefaultClassLoader.loadClass(DefaultClassLoader.java:83)
    at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
    at org.apache.tools.ant.AntClassLoader.findBaseClass(AntClassLoader.java:1197)
    at org.apache.tools.ant.AntClassLoader.loadClass(AntClassLoader.java:990)
    at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
    at org.apache.axis.utils.ClassUtils$2.run(ClassUtils.java:187)
    at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
    at org.apache.axis.utils.ClassUtils.loadClass(ClassUtils.java:160)
    at org.apache.axis.utils.ClassUtils.forName(ClassUtils.java:100)
    at org.apache.axis.wsdl.fromJava.Emitter.setCls(Emitter.java:2079)
    at

The "ClassNotFoundException" is occuring via the Apache Axis Java2WSDL emitter. Assuming your HelloWorldImpl.java file is located under src/com/tibco/webservice/test/ and is compiling cleanly, this exception means that the class or something it depends upon could not be loaded from the context of the Web project being targetted by the Web service wizard. Perhaps the most common cause of this is having your Java class in a Java project instead of directly in the target Web project, coupled to the fact that the Web service wizard does not automatically create project Java build path dependencies between Web projects and Java projects.

Is your HelloWorldImpl.java file in a Java project? If so, either...
1. Move your Java file(s) into the target Web project for your service, or
2. Open properties on your target Web project, and use the J2EE Module Dependencies page to select your Java project as a module dependency. This will have the side effect of including your Java project in your Web project's build path, at which point HelloWorldImpl should be loadable by the emitter running in the context of the Web project.
Assigned to you, Kathy. Thanks - CB.
As we have not heard from the originator after 10 months.  I'm closing this defect as invalid.  Please re-open with the information requested if this is still a problem with recent WTP drivers.
